There's no doubt here. This is 100% the best game in the WORLD. From the second you start you'll be caught in to the game, and you won't quit without thinking: "I want more". If you haven't played the single-player campaign - GO BUY IT! 
It IS worth it, believe me...... While we "wait for HL3 this is the thing!

La segunda parte del mejor juego de la historia. Nos encontramos con otro mundo, la muerte de Nihilant trajo consecuencias inesperadas, la Tierra está bajo el control de los Combine, una nueva oportunidad para que el hombre correcto en el momento incorrecto, pueda hacer la diferencia. Las armas clásicas y algunas nuevas, excelentes y detallados escenarios con muy buena música dinámica hacen una experiencia de juego completa. Nuevos personajes y enemigos que llegan para enriquecer la historia y la trama cada vez más compleja e interesante....la obra maestra de Valve.

An FPS that set the stage for all to come after it. Still beautiful, even by today's standards, Half-Life 2 is a game that I'll still replay every now and then to remind myself what makes great games great.

Easy to get into, fun to play and even people who usually don't like shooters will still enjoy themselves. 

Also, headcrabs are cute!

My favorite game ever. Nothing can cap it, or its mods. We owe gaming as it is today to the Half-Life franchise.

Мир, в котором Вы окажетесь – чужой. Перед Вами пронесутся роскошно проработанные ответвления сюжета, ни одно из которых не даст себя исследовать. Никто не даст права остановиться, и никто не остановит, чтобы объяснить, что происходит с такой чужой «родной» планетой… 
Эти вопросы, а также сотни новых, будут мучить Вас на протяжении всей игры. Ответы же будут ускользать подобно человеку в костюме, который время от времени будет появляться в самых неожиданных местах, просто для того чтобы исчезнуть спустя считанные секунды.
One of my favorite FPS games.  Very well thought out story, decent graphics, and smart AI.
if you have not played this game yet, stop reading, and start playing! naow!

One of the best FPS games of all time. Manages to combine a gripping story, a fully realised world, and interesting characters in a game that just keeps getting better. There are plenty of weapons that are fun to use, including the Gravity gun which turns simple objects into deadly amunition. Every location feels varied, from prison breaks, to deserted highways, to cities devoid of hope. Plenty of enemies and exploration mean you'll spend just as much time exploring a deserted building for secrets as you will shooting. The game throws many scenarios at you to keep things fresh, like multiple vehicles, being able to set up enemy turrets and mines as traps, and even turning vicious insect wild life into an army. You'll lead groups of rebels in action packed set pieces, and explore haunted towns devoid of any life... except the zombies... but zombies AREN'T alive... so yeah. If you love first person shooters and haven't played the Half Life series yet, then you are missing out.
PLAY THE ENTIRE SERIES HALF LIFE , HALF LIFE 2 , HALF LIFE 2 EPISODE 1 & 2 OR YOU WILL REGRET IT..... never played a better series. Portal + Half Life = the best games you will ever play

A game that must be owned by all people who use Steam. It has a lengthy campaign, flawless execution in everything. Looks beautiful. Play the game and you will see why it's one of the best game series of all time.

What story telling SHOULD be in FPS games. The weapons all feel useful and you need to use your head when fighting cause you never know when you may need to use X or Y weapon. The physics make you think less with "video game logic" and more with common sense. It's pretty refereshing. If you are looking for a great single player fps experiance, I recommend this
awesome game, every pc gamer should own it!

This game could easily be my favorite FPS of all time. Since you are using Steam, I am sure you already have this game and have played it, but if not, fix that. With mods, this game can look better than 80-90% of modern games, but that's not the real draw to this game. Valve developers prove again that they are masters of telling a story in an FPS game. They created some of the best characters in gaming and settings in City 17. I have played through this game 5 or 6 times and might just play it again... and probably again until HL episode 3 or HL3 comes out.

5/5

Imagine up to twenty of hours of unique riveting action in a dystopian world and you have Half-Life 2.

In 2004, when everything in first-person shooter worlds save for your enemies and scripted objects were static, Half-Life 2 introduced the gravity gun and with that a new level of interaction never before seen in FPS's. Even today, many other shooters haven't progressed much further. Half-Life 2 is a legend in the world of video games and its release is an epoch in the timeline of the greatest video games ever made.

9.5/10 (ไม่ใช่คะแนนเฉลี่ย)
One of the best games I have ever played!

2004 was a huge year for the shooter genre. Every single platform had at least one major FPS released that year. The PC had Doom 3, Far Cry, and Half Life 2. The GameCube had Metroid Prime 2, the PS2 had Killzone, and the Xbox, of course, had Halo 2. And while Halo's multiplayer made it the most important of the group, it was Valve's much-anticipated sequel that took the crown as the best. As the only game of the bunch to not include its own multiplayer component (CS: Source doesn't count), it is perhaps not as surprising as it seemed at the time that Half Life 2 was an adventure that excelled in almost every area. Its most obvious improvement was the new physics engine, something that Valve took every opportunity to show off, marking not only a remarkable technical achievement, but using that achievement as an integral part of the gameplay. Like Doom 3, Half Life 2 allowed every weapon to be carried at once, and the core mechanics were virtually identical to its predecessor (Gravity Gun aside). 

But gameplay was not what made Half Life 2 one of the greatest games ever made. That honor fell to almost everything else about the game; the sharp writing, terrifying atmosphere, incredible art direction, Hollywood-quality voice acting, and engrossing storyline. The universe Valve had created was nothing short of astounding, and the developer remains unmatched in its ability to tell a wordless story using nothing but the Source engine's expansive library of assets. Players who looked at each locale closely enough were rewarded with countless subplots, often touchingly told with nothing but blood, bullet holes, and overturned couches. Players want Half Life 3 not for the next evolution of the genre, but for one last chance to marvel at Valve's unmatched talent of merging story with technology to create some of the classiest games in history.

Still holds up incredibly well close to fifteen years after its release. Blew the minds of everyone who played it when it first came out and brought the games industry into a new era. Give it a try if you haven't already - you won't regret it.
One of the most influential games ever. Beautfiully weaves action and story in a way not seen before (or since) in a FPS. Excellent physics and very engrossing.

Half Life in my opinion was the best game in the 90's. Half Life is the best game in the 2000's. Now there are other great games too but I think this one deserves a little more spotlight. People might have a problem with the way levels are set up on how its so linear. Thats not the point. Look at the story. Its a pretty damn good one for a video game. Also, I don't care for its graphics but this game had amazing graphics and physics from the year 2004. Take a look at other games from that year, and look back and  HL2. You will see why. A game for FPS fans, sc fi fans, people who like stories, and pretty much for everyone who isn't boring and tasteless.

Apesar de eu tivera desgostado de alguns spectos em half-life, eu achei que a valve faria com que isso se intensificasse na sequência da série. Me enganei, e como gostei. Half-Life 2 consegue perfeitamente fazer o equilíbrio de terror, ação e descanso durante toda a trama. Gráficos ultramente bem feitos, apesar de ter sentido que a engine source atrapalhou em alguns elementos do cenário, como quando você tem que passar pulando de objeto em objeto, e estes não reagiam fisicamente bem. Fora isso, as partes em deve controlar o carro, lancha (ou qualquer nome que se dê àquilo) e guindastes foram muito bem feitas, e o melhor é que o jogo não tira a sensação de FPS. Recomendo muitíssimo

Half-Life 2 is truely one of the single greatest video games ever made and that I have ever played. I know that that might sound like hyperbole but it is very good. Even when you factor in this game's release date (nearly 10 years ago) It absolutely stands the test of time. When you go back to play the some of the other big titles of 2004 such as GTA San Andreas. Metal Gear Solid 3 and Hitman: Contracts none of them have aged as well as this. 
Half-Life 2 is often called the "Citizen Kane" of video games (Its a great film go watch it) and I think that is is most definitely deserving of that distinction.
I should also mention that you absolutely DO NOT have to play the first one in order to enjoy Half=Life 2.

I held off on this game, playing it in bits and pieces over time but just recently restarted and played through in long sessions in preparation for Half-Life: Alyx. Over 15 years later, this game is still the standard and holds up beautifully. Great storytelling, puzzles, graphics, sound, everything. At this point in time, I recommend playing the "Half-Life 2: Update" mod (free from the Steam store but requires the base game) as it includes minor graphical enhancements that bring the game even closer to today's standards. However, the main game functions exactly the same and if you don't mind the graphical difference then the base game is close enough. Overall, I absolutely enjoyed this game and I cannot wait to experience more of this series.
HL series is amazing. Don't just get this game. Buy the Half-Life Complete package. It's definitely worth it.
